practice_cycles.short_explanation_for_cycle: I need to get your hands moving reliably and your internal clock set before we try to hit advanced speeds or complex theory.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Metronome-based chord switching and open-position scales
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Active listening and transcription of basic melodies

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Open chords and down-stroke strumming at 60 BPM
difficulty_profile.challenging: Syncopated rhythms and clean transitions between barred chords

objective: Cleanly transition between 10 standard chords at 80 BPM
Identify all notes on the E and A strings within 3 seconds
subjective: Feelings of reduced tension in the fretting hand
Sense of 'locking in' with a metronome click

practice_cycles.short_explanation_for_cycle: Now that you're stable, I'm moving you up the neck to integrate the CAGED system and start connecting different positions.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: CAGED system shape connecting and pentatonic patterns
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Functional theory applied to 12-bar blues progressions

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Basic 12-bar blues in a single position
difficulty_profile.challenging: Soloing across the entire neck while targeting chord tones

objective: Play major and minor scales in 5 positions at 100 BPM
Improvise a 32-bar solo using only chord tones
subjective: Feeling of the fretboard 'opening up' and appearing less random
Confidence in moving between chord shapes mid-song

objective: BPM thresholds for scales and technical exercises
Number of songs memorized and performed without errors
Accuracy percentage in ear training intervals
subjective: Perceived clarity of tone in complex passages
Consistency of practice habit under high-volume load

architect_notes: The 24-hour weekly commitment is significant; I have distributed this to prevent repetitive strain injury by alternating between physical drills and theory/ear training.
I am prioritizing rhythm and fretboard visualization over speed, as speed is an emergent property of accuracy.
The transition from level 1 to level 4 is a multi-year journey; this strategy covers the first 24 weeks of that progression.

details.reason: User initiated a new learning session.

timeline.title: Initial Practice Strategy Created
timeline.summary: Initial practice strategy created for ['Learn Guitar'].

details.reason: Sufficient information provided to create initial practice system.

constraints.dropout_risk: Physical strain or burnout due to 24h/week volume
